name: NPR
text:
The U.S. is still seeing roughly 20,000 new coronavirus cases a day. 

Hot spots have emerged in California, along with certain counties in every southern state.

"We're very concerned that our public health message isn't resonating," the CDC's head says.
https://t.co/bsWD355Bha

name: NPR
text:
Evangelical Christians traditionally focus on individual sin and salvation. For some, that informs how they confront systemic racism.

"It starts first in your own heart," one pastor says, "then we deal with the racism that exists in the hearts of others." https://t.co/7OjkBaX813
